title: Teenager suffers allergic reaction after McDonald’s put tomato on wrap
text:
Jade Davies says she asked staff not to include any tomato in her meal (Picture: Liverpool Echo)

An 18-year-old woman was left with a swollen throat and covered in rashes after McDonald’s staff put tomato in her meal.

Jade Davies is allergic to the fruit and insists she asked staff to remove any trace of it from her order on Sunday at the branch in Liverpool.

But she says she tasted it as soon as she bit in to her BBQ, chicken and bacon wrap and immediately broke out in hives.

McDonald’s have since apologised and say procedures to avoid inaccurate orders were not followed at the branch in Speke, Liverpool.

Now Jade feels worried whenever she goes out to eat and is warning other people to check their food for mistakenly placed allergens before they dig in.

She was left with a swollen face and covered in rashes after eating the wrap (Picture: Liverpool Echo) Recalling her sickness inducing meal, she said: ‘I felt a tingling sensation, like an itch in the back of my throat which was swelling.

‘At first I was panicking, I had been to the walk-in centre the day before and was on oxygen as my allergies can trigger my asthma.

‘When I bit into the tomato, I didn’t know if my airwaves would become blocked and my eyes would start to puff.’

She said her boyfriend told her her face had gone bright right and had also started swelling.

Jade, from Garston, Liverpool, said her reaction could have been even more severe if she had not taken her antihistamine that morning.

She is warning others to double check their food for allergens before tucking in (Picture: Liverpool Echo) She says if things escalated any further she would have had to use her epipen and potentially go to A&E.

When she went to confront the manager of the branch in New Mersey Retail Park, Jade claims she was told there was ‘nothing they could do’.

The disgruntled customer added: ‘I was offered a refund and a replacement of my meal, but this isn’t good enough.’

Jade says she also suffered an allergic reaction at a McDonald’s on September 8 because staff added tomato to her meal, despite asking them to not include any.

She emailed the company’s customer service team who apologised for the incident, offered a £5 voucher and said: ‘We are confident that you will see improvements on future visits’.

Jade added: ‘I just want to raise awareness, all I want is to say to people to start checking their food, there needs to be something done about it as they are not doing enough.

Jade said she felt a tingling sensation and swelling at the back of her throat soon after biting the chicken and bacon wrap (Picture: Liverpool Echo) ‘I’m starting to worry now when I eat, I have to check the food.

‘I don’t know whether I would take the risk to go back.’

A McDonald’s spokesperson said: ‘We’d like to apologise to this customer for their experiences with this restaurant.

‘We have a number of procedures in place to avoid inaccurate orders and are disappointed that these were not followed.

‘All staff in the restaurant have been reminded of the procedure to take when serving a customer with allergens.

‘The customer is currently in contact with our customer services team in order to find a resolution.’

description: A woman from Garston, Liverpool, had an allergic reaction after staff at the New Mersey Retail Park branch in Speke, added tomato to her wrap.
